_header: O sapientia of the Father surmounting all thing
_description: The Seven O’s of Christ — eight stanzas rhyme royal with original Latin interspersed

BLHar45.First Lines:
O sapiencia of þe ffader surmountyng all thyngProcedyng from
                    his mowth his hestis to fulfill…
BLHar45.Last Lines:
…The hye mygth of god þe mystery first be ganeȜe
                    dameseles of Ierusalem why wonder ȝe so thane
BLHar45.Note:
Added to originally blank leaves after end of the main text in this MS,
                    by a fifteenth-century hand; Latin preceding first English stanza is ‘O
                        sapiencia que ex ore Altissimi prodisti / Attingens a fine usque ad finem
                        fortiter…’ (f. 168)
BLHar45.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 90-2.
